title: Best Way to Thunderbird Backup Emails
content:
Backing up Thunderbird emails is very important to prevent any data loss. You can backup Mozilla Thunderbird emails by following the given steps:

  • Go to the path C:\Users\*ProfileName*\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\*Profile.default*\
  • Copy the MBOX files which you want to backup.
  • Now, you can save the copied files to external drive, or network storage media.

This is how you can take thunderbird backup emails Mozilla Thunderbird backup with manual methods. However, if you are finding an automated solution for this, you can use Thunderbird backup tool. Here are two best tool you can use, Aryson Thunderbird Backup Tool and ConverterTools Thunderbird Converter Tool. Hope you find the post helpful.

Thanks & regards
creator: sumanrawat2508

title: Problemi di ricezione mail dall'inizio dell'anno (2023)
content:
Buongiorno a tutti, dall'inizio dell'anno ho problemi a scaricare la posta con Thunderbird (v102.6.1 64bit). Non risco a scaricare la mail di Alice (ho una connessione Wind 3) ma riesco a spedirla: quando premo il tasto Scarica Messaggi non succede assolutamente nulla. Non riesco a scarica la mail di Gmail e non la spedisco per un errore del certificato del peer. Non riesco a scaricare la mail da account mail.com con l'errore: "Si è verificato un errore TLS che non può essere ignorato. Si tratta di un errore di handshake o probabilmente la versione TLS o il certificato usato dal server imap.mail.com non sono compatibili". Ho lo stesso errore cercando di scaricare la mail pec di Aruba. Sembra che solo l'account di Libero continui a funzionare. Fino alla fine dell'anno scorso funzionava tutto e ovviamente non ho cambiato nulla. Ho controllato le varie impostazioni e sembra tutto giusto. Forse qualche certificato di qualche server è scaduto e va rinnovato ma non ho idea di come fare. O forse il problema è altrove.

Qualcuno ha qualche suggerimento?

Grazie

title: Dark mode in General Settings makes accessed Google calendars monochrome
content:
I am running Thunderbird 64-bit v. 102.6.1 under Ubuntu jammy 22.04 with gnome desktop.

Like many others, setting a "Themes" to "Dark" only changes the menu bars and folder lists to a dark background but not email bodies. The way I found to also be able to read emails with a dark background was to go into Edit > Settings > General > "Language & Appearance" section, "Colors" button and setting a dark-colored background and choosing "Always" for "Override the colors specified by the content with my selections above" -- however, this also makes Google calendars that I access via Tbird add-ons like g-hub lite or G Suite to a monochrome color, which makes it very difficult to read the calendars or to know what the current day is. Is there a way around this? That is, be able to set viewing with a dark background (mails, calendars) but not affect color-coding of the different calendars?

Thanks in advance to any tips!
creator: nymphnode

title: Back Up IMAP Folders to NAS (with live access)
content:
Greetings, Tbirders,

I'm trying to find a way to archive IMAP folders from multiple accounts for the purpose of historical record and reference to my NAS, but still have the content accessible via two or three machines.

I've tried the 'local folders' extension, but it seems that it doesn't work well with two or more machines and I lose the indexing, so that when a second machine accesses the folder, something 'breaks' and the messages disappear.

Would using the native Tbird 'archive' function work if I were to point the respective accounts to a corresponding folder to my NAS? Basically, I'm just trying to find a way to offload messages from local machines to my NAS and as a bonus, back up the server to the cloud by way of disaster recovery.

Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
creator: robert.k

title: No encryption of all messages stored on vendors' servers (e.g. Outlook, Google and others)
content: Will and possibly Thunderbird allow encryption of all messages stored on vendor servers (e.g., Outlook, Google and others), such as archived messages and all others that were not encrypted sender-receiver? Will and possibly when will integrated PGP enable encryption of all messages, including those not encrypted during communication, with a private PGP key?

title: Thunderbird not an option to send emails from Quickbooks
content:
On our old computer we set up our Quickbooks accounting software to send emails and invoices through Thunderbird, which works fine. We now have a new laptop and are trying to transfer Quickbooks over to it. However, Thunderbird isn't an option in the 'Send Forms' preference box, the only option is 'Webmail (Hotmail/Live, Gmail, Yahoo Mail, Others)'.

Both computers are running Quickbooks Premier 2016 Desktop (UK version) on Windows 10 and Thunderbird version 102.6.1 (32 bit). So far I've checked that both Quickbooks and Thunderbird are 32 bit, updated both programs, checked that Thunderbird is the default mail client, sent a test email to Thunderbird via Word to check that attachments work ok and run the fixmapi.exe file. The only difference I can see is that the old PC is 32 bit and the new laptop is 64 bit, but I don't think that matters if both programs are 32 bit unless someone knows otherwise.

Does anyone have any other ideas how to get Quickbooks to recognise Thunderbird as an email option?

title: messages not displaying in folder
content:
This one really has me stumped. I've got a POP account with many folders. In a couple of cases, the folder does not display messages. For example, there's a folder called FINANCE. In the folder pane, I'm told there are more than 400 messages in the folder. When I search local folders for a particular message, the search window tells me there are 4 relevant messages in this folder. When I go to my profile in Windows Explorer, there I find both the FINANCE.MSF and corresponding FINANCE file (no extension). They both display lots and lots of messages in Windows Notepad.

The only thing I can see that these problem folders have in common is that they all have sub-folders. But not all such "parent" folders have this problem.

I tried re-starting and I tried compacting folders.

Any ideas how I can restore this display to where it was yesterday?

Many thanks, Jeanne Thunderbird 102.6.1 (32-bit) (Windows)

title: Thunderbird - Hotmail/Outlook times out/fails waiting for client input when SENDING an e-mail
content: At some point, after 15+ years of using Thunderbird and Hotmail, it stopped SENDING e-mail from the Hotmail account, even though it would still download new messages. Could still send messages from another ISP account. Have to save the message composed in Thunderbird then log in to the Hotmail web interface to send it. Went round and round with AVG anti-virus to see if it was blocking sending e-mail, then worked with Microsoft support. Eventually removed the Hotmail account from Thunderbird, re-added the Hotmail account to Thunderbird, and it worked, for a while. Downloading a lot of messages in IMAP, so that they stay on the Hotmail server takes a long time. Sometimes will have to close Thunderbird, then resume the downloading of messages later. Trying to send a message, when it is now FAILING again, could it be that Thunderbird is WAITING UNTIL IT HAS COMPLETELY FINISHED DOWNLOADING ALL OF THE MESSAGES in some sort of queue, before it gets back to seeing that the user is trying to SEND a message, and to process that and communicate with the Hotmail server?

title: Emails from Mozilla.
content:
I've received an email, along with <<29/12/2022, 12:04 pm You earned the New Member badge on Mozilla Connect>>. Thank you.

Regarding this email, I was preparing to be away from home and not accessing emails, when this arrived. I notice the link expires in fifteen minutes!! Even if I was home I am not necessarily sitting at computer.

I have just tried to go into the message via your link. I see this message << 413 Request Entity Too Large >>. I did submit a question so wonder if the question is answered via this link. It all seems very complex for we ageing users who are not too computer literate.

Is there a way for me to find out if my question has an answer?

I've tried emailing to Community@... and the email won't go! Message is re non-existent Domain. It would be great if there was a straight-forward way to email, for an answer to a question.

Thank you for reading.
creator: MimJ

title: Thunderbird 102.6.1 gets stuck checking password when adding new account.
content: Thunderbird 102.6.1 gets stuck checking password when adding new account. Windows 10 environment. The correct password is being used. It appears other people have experienced this problem and solutions proposed have been to remove/re-install Thunderbird, don't save or provide password when adding the account, etc. but NONE of those work here. Others have suggested this has something to do with maybe version 102 and I tend to agree with that opinion. The only way I have been able to resolve this problem is to completely remove Thunderbird 102.6.1 and then re-install an older version (e.g. 78.13.0). Then use the exact same information to add the account and it works perfectly. No kidding! So has something changed around version 102 in the way new accounts are added? Like the new account setup wizard?
creator: blmist

title: Thunderbird error with window size
content:
Thunderbird 102.6.1

With "Windows 10" scale and layout set to 100% there is no problem. When set to 125% there is the following problem. Thunderbird app is opened. Thunderbird window size is normal. If you click to sign into another user and then resign into the orginal account the Thunderbird window is now very small. Thunderbird cannot keep the same window size if you sign into another account and then resign in.

Can you fix this problem?
creator: k.j.mosley

title: Thunderbird opens but accounts are gone
content:
I am using Thunderbird 102.6.1. I used Thunderbird this morning and everything was fine. I shut my computer and it should have gone to sleep. When I returned tonight, it appears that Windows had updated and restarted the computer. I say all of this because Thunderbird may have been forced closed and this could be a source of the problem.

In any case, when I opened Thunderbird this evening, it opened to an account set up page. Home was opened in another tab, but all my accounts, folders, address books were missing. I looked in the profiles folder and it seems my profile is intact. It's like Thunderbird knew about my profile folder and thought it was loading it, but then it didn't actually load it at all. I've tried some various things but have yet to find a solution.
creator: spheric1

content: I have thunderbird for my mail. I Use google for my mail server. I want to turn off Read receipts from emails people send me. I think I get emails that I know are from foreign hackers. Can I turn off this in thunder bird or do I have to go to google my mail server and turn it off?
creator: tneklas

title: Thunderbird -  sending blank referer request post
content:
I've used Mozilla email clients for decades and am pleased with their performance. However, in recent weeks, IPs using Thunderbird to send mail from servers owned by webhost MidPhase.com are being blocked due to "sending blank referer request post which seems to be like a bot threat". The host has placed an exception for me on their firewall, but during cleanup cycles, it appears the exception is dropped and I am placed in email jail until I convince MidPhase to re-add the exception.

Do you agree this behavior can be caused by Thunderbird? I have no desire to use any other email client, but this situation is baffling me.

My contact at MidPhase is Lynden Gillespie. I do not have his personal email address. What additional information can I supply to support resolution of the issue?

Regards, Kent Herrington

Thunderbird 102.6.1 (64 bit) on Win10Pro build 19045 connecting to my shared host MidPhase.com for domain theporch.net
creator: kent.herrington

title: Thunderbird, Google sync and "Other calendars" from external sources

They are: - Facebook events calendar added through HTTPS URL - some other website's calendar added through Webcal URL - a calendar created and managed by an external app through API

Few other calendars from there, like holidays from various religions, got automatically added. Can I sync them somehow or do they need to be added manually?
